revised_title: Leonard Hawkes: A Pioneering Geologist and Educator
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Leonard Hawkes, a prominent British geologist, who made significant contributions to the fields of geology, volcanology, and petrology. Hawkes was an active field-worker, particularly in Iceland, where he conducted research on volcanology, igneous petrology, and glaciology. He also served as a Secretary and later President of the Geological Society of London. Throughout his career, Hawkes was a dedicated educator, building up the Geology department at Bedford College in the University of London and advocating for the admission of men undergraduates.
